decision_conditions: The proposed part single, part two storey side/rear extension, by reason of its depth, would appear as an unacceptably dominant and visually intrusive feature in the rear garden harmful to the character and appearance of the surrounding area contrary to Local Plan Policy 7 and the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document.

The proposed part single, part two storey side/rear extension, by reason of its depth and position close to the boundary, would be an intrusive and unneighbourly development and have an adverse effect on the amenity of the adjacent occupiers at nos. 91 and 95 Elmhurst Drive, Hornchurch, contrary to Local Plan Policy 7 and the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to Mr Walker (agent) by e-mail on 09/03/22.

Please be advised that approval of this application from 1st September 2019 (either by London Borough of Havering, or subsequently by PINS if allowed on appeal following a refusal by London Borough of Havering) will attract a liability payment of £17,550 plus indexation in Community Infrastructure Levy (CIL). This charge has been levied under s.206 of the Planning Act 2008 and includes both the Mayor of London's CIL and Havering Council's CIL.
London Borough of Havering, as CIL collecting authority, has responsibility for the collection of the Mayoral CIL, in addition to Havering's CIL, on commencement of the development.

Your proposal is subject to a CIL Liability Notice indicating a levy of £2,925 plus indexation for the application, based on the Mayoral CIL levy rate for Havering of £25/sq.m plus Havering's charging rate for residential of £125/sq.m (Zone A), and the floorspace of 117 square metres.
You are advised to visit the planning portal
